replies.body: Heimerdinger Top? or Mid? We even saw Heimer in Bot lane. Which lane do you prefer the most? Why?

he's pretty safe to pick on mid and bot lane. Top lane feels a lot more volatile since you're at your strongest when you have all your turrets out in an aggressive position. this opens you up to ganks and counterplay by the enemy freezing when his jungler is nearby or midlane is mia. if you lose track of these things you can get set behind pretty hard. The opposite situation exists if the enemy gets no help and you harass and kill him under turret constantly

o and i prefer mid cuz you can push and help the jgler with either crab, and after you push the tower go help either lane !
Heim jg is where its at boi. fast clears with turrets and cc for ganks.

What's the best way to set up turrets? Is there a specific formation or way they should be placed?

Really awesome to see this on the Boards. Thanks to Wuks setting it up and thanks Heisendong and Gunslinger for spending the day answering!

yea man it's cool they set this up. i usually make a triangle formation ( i guess 3 points almost always make a triangle xD ) with one in front and two behind if I'm being defensive or two in front and one behind if I'm being aggressive. usually you can put them on the middle of the lane so they're easy to protect and push with. if you put them too far up the creeps will fuck them up as the waves are resetting and they will die very easily. you can hide a turret in the lane bushes for vision and pressure. if the enemy has lots of aoe, don't clump them up. if he has lots of single target long range poke, like kennen q or ezreal q, put them between the creep wave so they can't be picked off

I personally like to keep in a < side ways triangle position to help give you moment speed , to not only give you the ability to harass and dodge skillshots but also potentially dodge a gank. 

I'm grateful for this opportunity thank you wuks, Heisendong and riot ! {{sticker:sg-kiko}}
In your experience, what is the biggest difference between low-elo and high-elo players in regards to playing as/against Heimerdinger?

People in high elo respect and understand the damage output. If heimerdinger does not hit the grenade, he will do much less damage. people wait and juke the grenade ability or use flash/ invulnerabilities on it. this happens much less in low elo. People in low elo just run into the turrets without thinking of the grenade or killing the turrets with abilties or smite. ppl in lower elo just stand within W poke range for no reason. just some things I've noticed.

I am trying to learn Heimer, but constantly find myself getting frustrated in lane and late game, as i feel my turrets just explode immediately. I also just suck at him lol.

You're possibly placing your turrets too aggressively.
Try placing turrets in a triangle. 

1 out front, 2 in the rear. This way you will likely only have to replace the front one.
Think of how the first wave looks when they smash together.
Place front turret behind your melee minions. (prevents many skill shots from hitting them)
Then your 2 rear turrets behind your ranged minions. (means you have turrets to run to for defense)
Experiment with different distances and you'll find the sweet spot.


Lategame it's more about your ult E than your q, unless you're killing objectives
What tips would you give to people playing with an Heimerdinger on their team? For example what would you like your support to do/look out for?

Supports that can push well early and help 2v3 when you get ganked- since you want as much pressure and poke early game are the best with heimer adc. garenteed CC is also very important, aka fiddle / karma can both push and pressure and have easy CC so you can combo your grenade with multiple turrets and a full W. Heimer loves to control areas, so when you're grouping for objectives, try to remove all their vision and control that area with the heimer. He does baron and elder super fast so look for catches when they come for vision and hopefully heimer can land a grenade ultimate
